title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Walmart is phasing out its decades-old quarterly bonuses for store workers, as the company implements hourly wage increases for hundreds of thousands of employees.

DoorDash, Grubhub and Uber Eats are suing New York City over its law permanently capping the amount of commissions the apps can charge restaurants.

The leaders of the Boston and Dallas Federal Reserve banks said they would sell off individual stocks they own and cease trading in individual securities.

ECB chief Lagarde signaled that the bank will keep monetary policy loose for some time.

The S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq fell 0.5%, 0.4% and 0.3%, respectively.

JPMorgan reached a deal to acquire the Infatuation, which owns Zagat and other dining guides.

EasyJet rebuffed a takeover proposal from smaller rival Wizz Air.

The FDA said it needed more time before deciding whether e-cigarettes made by Juul and others can remain on the U.S. market.

What's News: Business & Finance
